module.p: dùisg wake up is an intransitive (non-durative) telic verb, with verbal noun dùsgadh (occasionally dùisgeadh or even dùisg).

Examples from Gairm –
[...] ’S bha iad ’nan suidhe an sin ag òl uisge-beatha fad na h-oidhch’, na ceathrar aca. An dràsda ’s a rithist shealladh Iain a-mach air an uinneig ris a’ mhuir ’s na h-eileanan. [...] Chaidil e airson greiseag ’s nuair a dhùisg e anns a’ mhadainn bha a bheul salach le blas an uisge-bheatha. Choisich e mach ás a’ bhàta a-measg nam faoileagan, ga[n] sguabadh air falbh le a làmhan, agus lean e air suas an aon rathad a bh’ ann gus an ruigeadh e an tigh. [...]
[...] And they were sat there drinking whisky all night, the four of them. Now and again John would look out the window at the sea and the islands. [...] He fell asleep for a while and when he woke up in the morning his mouth was dirty with the taste of the whisky. He walked out of the boat among the gulls, brushing them away with his hands, and he continued up the only road that there was until he reached the house. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn masculine

lix.gd: A Dhiarmaid! am bheil thu ’nad dhùsgadh?
Faodaidh an gille a bhith ’na dhuisg [...]
Aig an dara bùth chun deach iad bha an ceannaiche agus a bhean nan dùisg, oir bha an leanabh aca tinn agus bha iad a’ feitheamh ris an dotair.
lix.tr: at the second store they went to the owener and his wife were awake, because their child was sick and thet were waiting for the doctor.

lix.gd: Bha sinn nar dùisg fad na h-oidhche.
lix.tr: We were awake all night long.

lix.gd: A bheil thu nad chadal fhathast? Chan eil. ’S ann a tha mi nam dhùisg.
lix.tr: Are you asleep still/yet? No. I am awake.

lix.gd: Bha i na làn dhùisg a-nise.
Tha seo a’ dùsgadh cuimhne air ...
